segment.source: Learn how a user can interact with a background app through the Cortana voice and canvas during the execution of a voice command.
segment.target: Learn how a user can interact with a background app through the Cortana voice and canvas during the execution of a voice command.

segment.source: Interact with a background app
segment.target: Interact with a background app

segment.source: Interact with a background app in Cortana
segment.target: Interact with a background app in Cortana

segment.source: Enable user interaction with a background app, through speech and text input in the Cortana canvas, while executing a voice command.
segment.target: Enable user interaction with a background app, through speech and text input in the Cortana canvas, while executing a voice command.

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.target: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands

segment.source: Voice Command Definition (VCD) elements and attributes v1.2
segment.target: Voice Command Definition (VCD) elements and attributes v1.2

segment.source: Cortana supports a complete turn-by-turn workflow with your app.
segment.target: Cortana supports a complete turn-by-turn workflow with your app.

segment.source: This workflow is defined by your app, and can support functionality such as:
segment.target: This workflow is defined by your app, and can support functionality such as:

segment.source: Prerequisites:
segment.target: Prerequisites:

segment.source: This topic builds on Launch a background app with voice commands in Cortana.
segment.target: This topic builds on Launch a background app with voice commands in Cortana.

segment.source: We continue here to demonstrate features with a trip planning and management app named Adventure Works.
segment.target: We continue here to demonstrate features with a trip planning and management app named Adventure Works.

segment.source: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.
segment.target: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.

segment.source: Create your first app
segment.target: Create your first app

segment.source: Learn about events with Events and routed events overview
segment.target: Learn about events with Events and routed events overview

segment.source: User experience guidelines:
segment.target: User experience guidelines:

segment.source: See Cortana design guidelines for info about how to integrate your app with Cortana and Speech design guidelines for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.
segment.target: See Cortana design guidelines for info about how to integrate your app with Cortana and Speech design guidelines for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.

segment.source: Feedback strings
segment.target: Feedback strings

segment.source: Compose the feedback strings that are both displayed and spoken by Cortana.
segment.target: Compose the feedback strings that are both displayed and spoken by Cortana.

segment.source: The Cortana design guidelinesprovides recommendations on composing strings for Cortana.
segment.target: The Cortana design guidelinesprovides recommendations on composing strings for Cortana.

segment.source: Feedback strings
segment.target: Feedback strings

segment.source: Content cards can provide additional context for the user and help you keep feedback strings concise.
segment.target: Content cards can provide additional context for the user and help you keep feedback strings concise.

segment.source: Cortana supports the following content card templates (only one template can be used on the completion screen):
segment.target: Cortana supports the following content card templates (only one template can be used on the completion screen):

segment.source: The image can be:
segment.target: The image can be:

segment.source: You can also let users launch your app in the foreground by clicking either a card or the text link to your app.
segment.target: You can also let users launch your app in the foreground by clicking either a card or the text link to your app.

segment.source: Completion screen
segment.target: Completion screen

segment.source: A completion screen provides the user with information about the completed voice command task.
segment.target: A completion screen provides the user with information about the completed voice command task.

segment.source: Tasks that take less than 500 milliseconds for your app to respond, and require no additional information from the user, are completed without further interaction with Cortana.
segment.target: Tasks that take less than 500 milliseconds for your app to respond, and require no additional information from the user, are completed without further interaction with Cortana.

segment.source: Cortana simply displays the completion screen.
segment.target: Cortana simply displays the completion screen.

segment.source: Here, we use the Adventure Works app to show the completion screen for a voice command request to display upcoming trips to London.
segment.target: Here, we use the Adventure Works app to show the completion screen for a voice command request to display upcoming trips to London.

segment.source: cortana background app completion screen
segment.target: cortana background app completion screen

segment.source: The voice command is defined in AdventureWorksCommands.xml:
segment.target: The voice command is defined in AdventureWorksCommands.xml:

segment.source: AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs contains the completion message method:
segment.target: AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs contains the completion message method:

segment.source: Hand-off screen
segment.target: Hand-off screen

segment.source: Once a voice command is recognized, Cortana must call ReportSuccessAsync and present feedback within approximately 500ms.
segment.target: Once a voice command is recognized, Cortana must call ReportSuccessAsync and present feedback within approximately 500ms.

segment.source: If the app service cannot complete the action specified by the voice command within 500ms, Cortana presents a hand-off screen that is shown until your app calls ReportSuccessAsync, or for up to 5 seconds.
segment.target: If the app service cannot complete the action specified by the voice command within 500ms, Cortana presents a hand-off screen that is shown until your app calls ReportSuccessAsync, or for up to 5 seconds.

segment.source: If the app service doesn’t call ReportSuccessAsync, or any other VoiceCommandServiceConnection method, the user receives an error message and the app service call is cancelled.
segment.target: If the app service doesn’t call ReportSuccessAsync, or any other VoiceCommandServiceConnection method, the user receives an error message and the app service call is cancelled.

segment.source: Here's an example of a hand-off screen for the Adventure Works app.
segment.target: Here's an example of a hand-off screen for the Adventure Works app.

segment.source: In this example, a user has queried Cortana for upcoming trips.
segment.target: In this example, a user has queried Cortana for upcoming trips.

segment.source: The hand-off screen includes a message customized with the app service name, an icon, and a Feedback string.
segment.target: The hand-off screen includes a message customized with the app service name, an icon, and a Feedback string.

segment.source: You can declare a Feedback string in the VCD file.
segment.target: You can declare a Feedback string in the VCD file.

segment.source: This string does not affect the UI text displayed on the Cortana canvas, it only affects the text spoken by Cortana.
segment.target: This string does not affect the UI text displayed on the Cortana canvas, it only affects the text spoken by Cortana.

segment.source: cortana background app hand-off screen
segment.target: cortana background app hand-off screen

segment.source: Progress screen
segment.target: Progress screen

segment.source: If the app service takes more than 500ms to call ReportSuccessAsync, Cortana provides the user with a progress screen.
segment.target: If the app service takes more than 500ms to call ReportSuccessAsync, Cortana provides the user with a progress screen.

segment.source: The app icon is displayed, and you must provide both GUI and TTS progress strings to indicate that the task is being actively handled.
segment.target: The app icon is displayed, and you must provide both GUI and TTS progress strings to indicate that the task is being actively handled.

segment.source: Cortana shows a progress screen for a maximum of 5 seconds.
segment.target: Cortana shows a progress screen for a maximum of 5 seconds.

segment.source: After 5 seconds, Cortana presents the user with an error message and the app service is closed.
segment.target: After 5 seconds, Cortana presents the user with an error message and the app service is closed.

segment.source: If the app service needs more than 5 seconds to complete the action, it can continue to update Cortana with progress screens.
segment.target: If the app service needs more than 5 seconds to complete the action, it can continue to update Cortana with progress screens.

segment.source: Here's an example of a progress screen for the Adventure Works app.
segment.target: Here's an example of a progress screen for the Adventure Works app.

segment.source: In this example, a user has canceled a trip to Las Vegas.
segment.target: In this example, a user has canceled a trip to Las Vegas.

segment.source: The progress screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.
segment.target: The progress screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.

segment.source: cortana background app progress screen
segment.target: cortana background app progress screen

segment.source: AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs contains the following progress message method, which calls ReportProgressAsync to show the progress screen in Cortana.
segment.target: AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs contains the following progress message method, which calls ReportProgressAsync to show the progress screen in Cortana.

segment.source: Confirmation screen
segment.target: Confirmation screen

segment.source: When an action specified by a voice command is irreversible, has a significant impact, or the recognition confidence is not high, an app service can request confirmation.
segment.target: When an action specified by a voice command is irreversible, has a significant impact, or the recognition confidence is not high, an app service can request confirmation.

segment.source: Here's an example of a confirmation screen for the Adventure Works app.
segment.target: Here's an example of a confirmation screen for the Adventure Works app.

segment.source: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through Cortana.
segment.target: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through Cortana.

segment.source: The app service has provided Cortana with a confirmation screen that prompts the user for a yes or no answer before canceling the trip.
segment.target: The app service has provided Cortana with a confirmation screen that prompts the user for a yes or no answer before canceling the trip.

segment.source: If the user says something other than "Yes" or "No", Cortana cannot determine the answer to the question.
segment.target: If the user says something other than "Yes" or "No", Cortana cannot determine the answer to the question.

segment.source: In this case, Cortana prompts the user with a similar question provided by the app service.
segment.target: In this case, Cortana prompts the user with a similar question provided by the app service.

segment.source: On the second prompt, if the user still doesn’t say "Yes" or "No", Cortana prompts the user a third time with the same question prefixed with an apology.
segment.target: On the second prompt, if the user still doesn’t say "Yes" or "No", Cortana prompts the user a third time with the same question prefixed with an apology.

segment.source: If the user still doesn’t say "Yes" or "No", Cortana stops listening for voice input and asks the user to tap one of the buttons instead.
segment.target: If the user still doesn’t say "Yes" or "No", Cortana stops listening for voice input and asks the user to tap one of the buttons instead.

segment.source: The confirmation screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.
segment.target: The confirmation screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.

segment.source: cortana background app confirmation screen
segment.target: cortana background app confirmation screen

segment.source: AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs contains the following trip cancellation method, which calls RequestConfirmationAsync to show a confirmation screen in Cortana.
segment.target: AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs contains the following trip cancellation method, which calls RequestConfirmationAsync to show a confirmation screen in Cortana.

segment.source: Disambiguation screen
segment.target: Disambiguation screen

segment.source: When an action specified by a voice command has more than one possible outcome, an app service can request more info from the user.
segment.target: When an action specified by a voice command has more than one possible outcome, an app service can request more info from the user.

segment.source: Here's an example of a disambiguation screen for the Adventure Works app.
segment.target: Here's an example of a disambiguation screen for the Adventure Works app.

segment.source: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through Cortana.
segment.target: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through Cortana.

segment.source: However, the user has two trips to Las Vegas on different dates and the app service cannot complete the action without the user selecting the intended trip.
segment.target: However, the user has two trips to Las Vegas on different dates and the app service cannot complete the action without the user selecting the intended trip.

segment.source: The app service provides Cortana with a disambiguation screen that prompts the user to make a selection from a list of matching trips, before it cancels any.
segment.target: The app service provides Cortana with a disambiguation screen that prompts the user to make a selection from a list of matching trips, before it cancels any.

segment.source: In this case, Cortana prompts the user with a similar question provided by the app service.
segment.target: In this case, Cortana prompts the user with a similar question provided by the app service.

segment.source: On the second prompt, if the user still doesn’t say something that can be used to identify the selection, Cortana prompts the user a third time with the same question prefixed with an apology.
segment.target: On the second prompt, if the user still doesn’t say something that can be used to identify the selection, Cortana prompts the user a third time with the same question prefixed with an apology.

segment.source: If the user still doesn’t say something that can be used to identify the selection, Cortana stops listening for voice input and asks the user to tap one of the buttons instead.
segment.target: If the user still doesn’t say something that can be used to identify the selection, Cortana stops listening for voice input and asks the user to tap one of the buttons instead.

segment.source: The disambiguation screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.
segment.target: The disambiguation screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.

segment.source: cortana background app disambiguation screen
segment.target: cortana background app disambiguation screen

segment.source: AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs contains the following trip cancellation method, which calls RequestDisambiguationAsync to show the disambiguation screen in Cortana.
segment.target: AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs contains the following trip cancellation method, which calls RequestDisambiguationAsync to show the disambiguation screen in Cortana.

segment.source: Error screen
segment.target: Error screen

segment.source: When an action specified by a voice command cannot be completed, an app service can provide an error screen.
segment.target: When an action specified by a voice command cannot be completed, an app service can provide an error screen.

segment.source: Here's an example of an error screen for the Adventure Works app.
segment.target: Here's an example of an error screen for the Adventure Works app.

segment.source: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through Cortana.
segment.target: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through Cortana.

segment.source: However, the user does not have any trips scheduled to Las Vegas.
segment.target: However, the user does not have any trips scheduled to Las Vegas.

segment.source: The app service provides Cortana with an error screen that includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and the specific error message.
segment.target: The app service provides Cortana with an error screen that includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and the specific error message.

segment.source: Call ReportFailureAsync to show the error screen in Cortana.
segment.target: Call ReportFailureAsync to show the error screen in Cortana.
